conclusion: To determine the distance fallen, calculate the area under the velocity-time graph for the interval.
Identify the interval of interest as from 10 to 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s. At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
The graph between 10 and 15 seconds forms a trapezoid.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 * (Base1 + Base2) * Height.
Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, and Height = 5 seconds.
The area under the graph from 10 to 15 seconds is exactly 75 meters.
